required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Internet-delivered Cognitive-Behavioral Intervention for Insomniac Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Programa Online de intervenção Cognitivo-Comportamental Para o Tratamento da Insónia em Sobreviventes Oncológicos

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of an internet-based cognitive-behavioral therapy intervention (SONO) to improve the sleep of Portuguese cancer survivors with insomnia.

detailed_description.textblock: Insomnia disorder comprises a complaint of poor sleep, associated with significant daytime disturbance, occurring at least 3 nights per week for at least 3 months. Insomnia is prevalent among cancer survivors and tends to be unremitting. Untread insomnia has been associated with increased cancer-related fatigue and impaired quality of life. Perceived cognitive impairments and psychological distress are decisive for seeking a sleep consultation. Cognitive-behavioral therapy is the gold-standard treatment for insomnia, but its costs are relatively high and there is a limited number of trained therapists. The main purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of an internet-based cognitive-behavioral intervention program, SONO, for Portuguese cancer survivors with insomnia. Participants will be randomly assigned to the experimental group or the waitlist control group. The SONO program intervention includes weekly sessions and it encompasses an educational component, a behavioral component, and a cognitive component. Professional feedback and guidance will be provided by a certified therapist. All eligible participants will complete a battery of questionnaires from baseline to postintervention, as well as follow-ups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
primary_outcome.description: Insomnia Severity Index (overall score 0-28 interpreted as follows: 0-7 absence of insomnia; 8-14 sub-threshold insomnia; 15-21 moderate insomnia; 22-28 severe insomnia)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
secondary_outcome.description: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (overall score 0-21, higher scores denote worse sleep quality)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
secondary_outcome.description: Multidimensional Fatigue Symptom Inventory-Short Form (overall score 24-96, higher scores denote higher levels of cancer-related fatigue)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
secondary_outcome.description: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality-of-life Questionnaire Core 30; World Health Organization Quality of Life - Brief (overall scores 0-100, higher scores indicate higher quality of life)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive Failures Questionnaire (overall score 0-100, higher scores denote more cognitive failures)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (total subscale 0-21, higher scores denote highest anxiety level)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment); 3-, 6- and 12- months follow-ups
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (total subscale 0-21, higher scores denote highest depression level)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Dysfunctional Beliefs and Attitudes About Sleep Scale (overall score 0-10, higher scores denote more erroneous beliefs)

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by dropout rate
other_outcome.description: Computed as the number of participants that dropped out before completing the intervention

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by program visit length
other_outcome.description: Computed as the average duration of participants' visits to the intervention

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by activities completion
other_outcome.description: Computed as the total number of activities completed by the participants during the intervention

other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to post-intervention (7 weeks after enrollment)

other_outcome.measure: Participants' attitudes towards internet-delivered intervention for insomnia
other_outcome.description: Attitudes Towards Online Treatment for Insomnia Scale

arm_group.description: Participants assigned to the experimental group receive immediate access to the SONO program, a web-based self-guided cognitive-behavioral intervention for insomnia consisting of 6 weekly sessions. A certified psychologist will monitor the participant's progress and provide feedback.
Participants assigned to the waitlist control group receive access to the SONO program after 7 weeks.

intervention.description: Treatment includes sleep hygiene, sleep restriction, stimulus control, and cognitive therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18+ years
- Provided informed consent
- Ability to read and write in Portuguese
- Ability to use a computer and/or smartphone, and the internet
- History of cancer, any type or stage
- An interval of 1 or more months from the end of active treatment (chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy)
- Subclinical or significant symptoms of insomnia (ISI scores>8) and positive screen for probable ICSD-3 insomnia disorder
- Ongoing sleep medication only accepted if the dosage has been stable during the last 3 months
- No participation in any other interventional study or clinical trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age ≤ 18 years
- Absence of clinically or subclinical significant symptoms
- No history of cancer
- Inability to provide informed consent
- Inability to use a computer and/or smartphone
- No access to the internet
- Another untreated sleep diagnosis
- Current major psychiatric or medical condition
- Pregnancy
- Parallel ongoing psychological treatment for insomnia
- Habitual night shift, or rotating shift-workers

responsible_party.investigator_title: PhD fellowship at Center for Research in Neuropsychology and Cognitive and Behavioral Intervention
